intro: Corydalis cashmeriana, commonly known as the Kashmir corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 4,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
